name: Kevin McDonald: From Improv to Sketch Intensive
rich_text:
Kevin McDonald: From Improv to Sketch Intensive

  • 📅 Date: Saturday, June 14
  • 🕙 Time: 10:00 AM - 5:00 PM (6 hours)
  • 🍽️ Lunch Break 1:00 PM - 2:00 PM
  • 📍 The DC Arts Center, 2438 18th St NW, Washington, DC 20009

About the Workshop

In this high-energy, hands-on workshop, Kids in the Hall’s Kevin McDonald teaches students how to generate sketch comedy through improvisation. Working in small groups, students improvise scenes which are then analyzed and developed with Kevin’s guidance (and comedic commentary). He walks the class through turning raw improv into a structured sketch—building characters, heightening the comedy, and shaping a narrative. Each scene is then performed again as a refined sketch. By the end of the intensive, students will create their own improvised scenes and begin transforming them into original sketches. It’s a fun, fast-paced crash course in writing without the blank page. This workshop includes a 1 hour lunch break.

About Kevin McDonald

Comedian, actor, writer and director Kevin McDonald founded “The Kids in the Hall” with friend Dave Foley, after they met in Toronto at Second City, and the television series ran from 1988-1995. In the troupe's television series and stage shows, he portrays several popular recurring characters, such as the King of Empty Promises, Sir Simon Milligan, and Jerry Sizzler. McDonald went on to appear in a variety of films including Boy Meets Girl, Lilo & Stitch, “Lilo & Stitch: The Series”, and Epic Movie.
On television, he has appeared on “The Martin Short Show,” “Ellen,” “That '70s Show,” “Seinfeld,” “Friends,” “NewsRadio,”  “MADtv,” “Arrested Development,” and “Corner Gas.” McDonald has also done voice work for various animated series, including Nickelodeon's “Invader Zim,” “The Angry Beavers,” “Catscratch,” and “Clerks: The Animated Series.” He also played an imaginary friend named Ivan in the episode ‘Sight For Sore Eyes’ on “Foster's Home for Imaginary Friends,” appeared in the music video for "Roses" by Outkast, and made an appearance in “Tim and Eric's Awesome Show.”
In 2006 McDonald hosted a CBC Television special, featuring several of Canada's best-known sketch comedy troupes. "Sketch with Kevin McDonald" won a Canadian Comedy Award (Best Taped Live Performance - The Minnesota Wrecking Crew). He was recently at the Just for Laughs Festival with the reunion of Kids in the Hall, and also with his show "Hammy and the Kids" with Craig Northey, based on his two dysfunctional families, his father ("Hammy") and the Kids in the Hall, as well as “Death Comes to Town” on CBC.
Along the way, Kevin was also in the movies, Sky High and Galaxy Quest. He did his podcast from 2016 to 2020. Just recently, he and the Kids in the Hall did another season of their sketch show for Amazon Prime.  He has also done a bunch of things that he forgets. And the world is better off for that.
body_2:
🍎 Prerequisites

  • No pre-requisites are required for this class.

🎟️ Registration:

  • Class Registration: $250
  • This class is limited to 16 students max

🍸 Location

  • 🚗 Parking garage nearby
  • ❌ This venue is not wheelchair accessible
  • 👧 Age Requirement 18+

📋 Policies

  • All sales are final. Refunds and exchanges are offered only when a class is canceled or rescheduled.
  • If you have questions, please email info@railscomedy.com

📣 Register today!

name: Finding Your Voice: Comedy Songwriting with Seann Cantatore
rich_text:
Finding Your Voice: Comedy Songwriting with Seann Cantatore

  • 📅 Date: Thursday, June 19
  • 🕙 Time: 7:00 PM - 9:30 PM
  • 🎭 The DC Arts Center, 2438 18th St NW, Washington, DC 20009
Writing a song can be daunting. Writing a funny song can be even daunting-er. In this workshop, musical comedian Seann Cantatore will break down the elements of comedy songwriting into a few simple steps, and then we’ll get right into the fun part. Each student will develop their own comedy song using improv, storytelling and their unique voice. You’ll be surprised by what you’re capable of creating in a short amount of time! And the class is there to support and collaborate with you along the way. If you enjoy utter silliness, this is the workshop for you.
body_2:
🍎 Prerequisites

  • No need to be a trained singer or instrumentalist! Musical and vocal technique is gorgeous, but it is not a prerequisite for this workshop.

🎟️ Registration:

  • Class Registration: $60
  • This class is limited to 10 students max

📗 Instructor Bio

Seann Cantatore is an NYC musician-turned-comedian who combines musical theater, improv and sketch into her solo shows. A classical and jazz-trained singer and pianist with over 12 years of professional experience, Seann brings the “music” in musical comedy to a whole different level. She believes in humor that welcomes everyone to the party and seeks to bring people together through laughter and song. With her whimsical wit and inviting presence, audiences feel right at home belly-laughing and confronting their deepest emotional vulnerabilities, alike.

🍸 Location

  • 🚗 Parking garage nearby
  • ❌ This venue is not wheelchair accessible
  • 👧 Age Requirement 18+

📋 Policies

  • All sales are final. Refunds and exchanges are offered only when a class is canceled or rescheduled.
  • If you have questions, please email info@railscomedy.com

📣 Register today!

name: Character Game, Part 2: Heat, Weight, and Organic Discovery with Kate Symes
rich_text:
Character Game, Part 2: Heat, Weight, and Organic Discovery with Kate Symes

  • 🗓️ Date: Sunday, June 1
  • 🕙 Time: 11:00 AM - 2:00 PM
  • 📍 The DC Arts Center, 2438 18th St NW, Washington, DC 20009
In this advanced workshop, we’ll move beyond quick character initiations and into the more subtle terrain of discovering character through the emotional temperature of the moment. Drawing inspiration from the grounded, character-first philosophy of TJ & Dave, we’ll explore how to identify character game not by invention, but by responding authentically to the heat (emotional charge) and weight (stakes or intensity) of the opening moments of a scene.
Through deep listening and emotional attunement, you’ll practice letting a character emerge naturally from the space between you and your scene partner — often before a single word is spoken. This workshop focuses on patient scene work that builds specific, human characters whose consistent behavior becomes the engine of the comedy.
body_2:
‍📕 Students will learn:

  • How to read emotional dynamics in real time and respond with clarity and presence.
  • How to allow character to emerge through behavior and reaction, rather than invention.
  • How to use small emotional shifts to build comedic patterns without sacrificing truth.

‍🎓 Students will walk away with:

  • A stronger grasp of how specific choices build richer, more playable characters.
  • A deeper ability to trust their instincts and emotional intelligence to create character.
  • Practice discovering and heightening character game without having to invent.

‍📚 This workshop's topics include:

  • Heat and Weight: Reading emotional temperature and intensity to discover character.
  • Organic Initiations: Letting the first moments reveal who you are and what matters.
  • Emotional Listening: Building scenes through behavioral and emotional responses.
  • Behavior as Game: How consistent emotional reactions become comedic patterns.

🍎 Prerequisites

  • Completion of Rails Comedy’s first Character Game workshop (titled Game On), or completion of the core curriculum at Washington Improv Theater or another long-form improv theater.

🎟️ Registration

  • Workshop Registration: $75
  • This workshop is limited to 10 students max

📗 Instructor Bio‍

Kate Symes has been performing improv in DC since 2010, and she started teaching and coaching in 2011. She has taught all levels of students the principles of improv: support, agreement, listening, and exploration. She is passionate about helping students find their sense of self-confidence, rediscover their ability to play, and take the skills they learn in the classroom into their daily lives or onto the stage.
She started her training at the DC Improv and continued on to complete the curriculum at Washington Improv Theater (WIT), complementing her studies along the way at Studio Theater, Second City, Upright Citizens Brigade, Magnet Theater, and People’s Improv Theater. Kate is a former member of many fantastic improv teams (full CV here), and she was most recently in WIT’s productions of POTUS Among Us and the White Elephant Holiday Blitz show. Now many of her improv friends have grown up and moved to the suburbs, or they get tired at 9 p.m., so she doesn’t perform as regularly as she once did, and sometimes she thinks she should do something about that. 
Kate has also coached and directed several teams and shows, including The Fourth Estate, a WIT Directors Series show that ran throughout winter 2019 to sold-out houses and acclaim from the performers’ parents, and Madeline, a WIT house ensemble known for its long-running hilarity. Kate wrote and directed a web series called The Newsroom, hosted a late-night-morning-talk-show called Wake Up Late with Denny and Kate, and has been featured on several podcasts nerding out about improv. She also teaches yoga and meditation, and has a corporate day job in her spare time. Check out all her offerings at https://www.katesymes.com/. 

🍸 Location

  • 🎭 The workshop will be at The DC Arts Center, 2438 18th St NW, Washington, DC 20009
  • 🚗 Parking garage nearby
  • ❌ This venue is not wheelchair accessible
  • 👧 Age Requirement 18+

📋 Policies

  • All sales are final. Refunds and exchanges are offered only when a workshop is canceled or rescheduled.
  • If you have questions, please email classes@railscomedy.com

📣 Register today!

name: Musical Improv for Newbies with Katie O’Donnell and Mike O’Connor
rich_text:
Musical Improv for Newbies with Katie O’Donnell and Mike O’Connor

  • 📅 Date: Wednesday, June 4
  • 🕙 Time: 6:30 PM - 9:30 PM (3 hours)
  • 📍 The DC Arts Center, 2438 18th St NW, Washington, DC 20009
Ever wanted to try musical improv in a judgement-free zone? This workshop is designed to introduce first-timers to the art of musical improv. We will focus on the basics of crafting and singing improvised songs as well as performing scenes that incorporate songs.
Participants will learn:
  • How to structure and sing a basic improvised song
  • Tactics for “writing” dynamic improvised songs on the spot
  • How to build toward a song-inspiring moment and create a compelling musical scene with other improvisers
  • Methods for building confidence and feeling rooted while singing in front of others
This workshop is useful for improvisers who are curious about how to do musical improv and want to learn in a structured-yet-easygoing setting with other newbies.
body_2:
🍎 Prerequisites
  • Participants ideally will have some non-musical improv training, such as an introductory or level 1 course. 
  • Participants ideally will have not learned musical improv in a structured environment but are somewhat comfortable singing in front of others. 
  • Having a strong sense of rhythm is very helpful for learning musical improv, but advanced singing and vocal skills are not required.
🎟️ Registration
  • Class Registration: $75
  • This class is limited to 10 students max
📗 Instructor Bios
Katie O’Donnell is a musical improv performer with experience at Washington Improv Theater (WIT), at Rails Comedy, and across DC’s indie improv scene. She is a member of WIT’s long-running ensemble iMusical and is a coach for the theater’s Musical Improv Conservatory program. She brings a background in musical theater and drama to her performing and coaching approaches, and she is dedicated to building positive ensemble experiences and sharing the joy of creating made-up musicals.
Mike O’Connor has been supporting improvisers from behind a keyboard since 2012, and he is currently an accompanist for iMusical. Dedicated to expanding DC’s musical improv scene, Mike is a cofounder of WIT’s Musical Improv Conservatory program and also serves as a teaching artist with WIT. He has musical directed and accompanied several musical improv groups with WIT, Rails Comedy, and comedy theaters in Austin, Texas. 
🍸 Location
  • 🚗 Parking garage nearby
  • ❌ This venue is not wheelchair accessible
  • 👧 Age Requirement 18+
📋 Policies
  • All sales are final. Refunds and exchanges are offered only when a class is canceled or rescheduled.
  • If you have questions, please email info@railscomedy.com
📣 Register today!
